div.p: 19 days ago

Governor Wolf announced today that all Pennsylvania public schools will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. This is a difficult announcement for all families and students, especially our seniors, the Class of 2020. Abington Heights is committed to providing the best opportunities, especially for our seniors, for all students in the coming months.
Click on this link for an on-line learning update including frequently asked questions, the high school schedule and a video clip from Assistant Superintendent Marc Wyandt.
Click on this link for an announcement about the next phase of on-line learning in Abington Heights.
Click on this link for an update on access to Chromebooks and a video from Assistant Superintendent Marc Wyandt.
Click on this link to access all of today's Remind announcements.
Governor Wolf announced today that Pennsylvania public schools will be closed for an indefinite amount of time. Click this link for more information on the district's on-line learning program.

Internet access can be a significant barrier in connecting students to school, especially during emergencies. Xfinity has opened its internet hotspots for free use during the current crisis. While it is recognized accessing these hotspots may not be possible in all of our municipalities, some residents and students may benefit. Xfinity has created a website with details including a coverage map to assist those wishing to gain access.

Families that qualify can receive free internet for 60 days in their homes with subsequent payments of $9.95 per month through the Internet Essentials program offered by Comcast. Families can learn more and fill out an application by visiting the Internet Essentials website.
Those experiencing difficulty accessing the Internet should either email AHSDInformation@ahsd.org or call (570) 585-8252.

p.span: Governor Wolf announced today that Pennsylvania public schools will remain closed for an additional week. Students are now scheduled to return to school on April 9, 2020. Adjustments to the 2019-2020 district calendar will be announced in the near future.

div.p: The College Board has issued some important information about AP exams. It looks like students who wish to take the exam(s) will have the option to do so at home this year. Check out the information AP has posted.
It was also announced that AP will offer on-line lessons that could be helpful for those wishing to take exams. Check out what is being offered and when.
Log in to your AP account by clicking here.
The Pennsylvania Department of Education announced that there will be no PSSA, PASA or Keystone exams offered this year.
The superintendent issued an update regarding a district-wide shutdown and related matters associated with the closure of schools.

All Abington Heights students can pick up grab-and-go meals beginning today from 11AM to 1PM at Clarks Summit Elementary School. Everyone will receive a bagged lunch and a bagged breakfast. Drive to the side parking lot where a tent is set up. There is no need to get out of your car. There is also no need to pile everyone in on the trip. Parents and caretakers should just have the name of the students and schools they attend for their family, neighbors on the block, etc... . Everything is free and all are welcome.
Governor Wolf ordered the closure of all Pennsylvania Public Schools through Friday, March 27, 2020.
The superintendent issued an update regarding the rapidly changing information about Coronavirus and the district's response.

div.div: COVID-19 is creating heightened national concern. Abington Heights is committed to providing transparent communication to our community. The district is monitoring developments closely and will respond to guidance from state and national agencies. Learn more from the Center for Disease Control and Prevention.

a.title: Visit Abington Heights Coronavirus Information Page

div.div:
In response to Governor Wolf's declaration on March 19, 2020, all Abington Heights School District Buildings are closed.
Anyone needing assistance should send an email to AHSDInfo@ahsd.org. The account is being monitored daily.

div.div: Grab-and-Go meals will continue to be served through the shutdown Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday, 11AM to 1PM. Come to the side parking lot at Clarks Summit Elementary School. No need to get out of the car. Just drive right up. Also no need to pile everyone in. Meals are free for all. Everyone welcome.

div.span: Abington Heights School District is now using Remind Notification Service

a.div:
To receive official communication directly from the School District, sign up for Remind Notification Service for information about delays, cancellations and emergency announcements.
Select this box link for Remind sign-up instructions.

span.data-emptytext: Abington Heights School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value: Abington Heights School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment

p.span: Abington Heights School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
